text: Let G = ({5}, {a, b}, R, S) be a context free grammar where the rule set Ris S — a.Sb | S5 | € Which of the following statements is true? A. G is not ambiguous B. There exist z, y € L(G) suchthat zy ¢ L(G) C. There is a deterministic pushdown automaton that accepts L(G) D. We can find a deterministic finite state automaton that accepts L(G) gatecse-2003 theory-of-computation context-free-language normal
